page.title: 01SUMMARY OF THE AREA.
page.content: The area is situated between the estuaries of the River Orwell and Deben {four miles East of Ipswich and two miles South of Woodbridge}. It is low, slightly undulating plateau of mainly sandy soil with patches of heavier soils particularly in two small tributaries of the Deben. The area, comprising parts of the Parishes of Martlesham, Waldringfield, Brightwell and Newbourne, is mainly rural, divided into large arable and mixed farms, with smaller areas of heathland, woodland and marshes. The chief centre of the population is Martlesham New Village developed in the last twenty years. This is separated from a growing industrial estate on the west by the recent eastern section of the Ipswich Southern By-pass which joins the A12 at Martlesham.
